page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: This is an area of gently undulating relief,with no steep slopes or high land. Most of the land is used for intensive arable farming, particularly for growing cereals and sugar beet. The farming is highly mechanised. Blofield is the main settlement in the area and is a moderate sized village. It is an old village with a church,2 pubs, a primary school and several shops. Blofield Heath and Hemblington Corner in the north of the area are smaller villages which have grown together. All these villages have grown over recent years with new eststes being built for people to live in, who commute to work in Norwich. The A 47, the Norwich to Great Yarmouth road runs through the area, though a by_pass has been built around Blofield.
